FY1920.Q31: CTG UAlbany – formerly known as the Center for Technology in Government at the State University of New York (SUNY) at Albany – is a research institute that works with governments worldwide to help transform public service through innovative approaches to, and applications of, technology, management, and policy. Established in 1993, we pursue new ways to use technology to address practical problems of information management and service delivery in government. CTG UAlbany has collaborated with hundreds of domestic and international researchers on understanding and applying emerging technologies. At the same time, CTG UAlbany has worked with scores of local, state, federal, and international government bodies as a trusted advisor and facilitator of management and policy decisions to govern the use of new technologies as tools for public service transformation.
FY1920.Q32: Work with governments worldwide transforming public services through innovations in technology, policy and management.
FY1920.Q91: Engage in innovative research and problem solving projects that address societal challenges
FY1920.Q101: Develop and teach innovative courses that integrate teaching and experiential education
FY1920.Q111: Provide students with internships that allow hands on learning through projects that address real world challenges and explore and develop innovative and sustainable solutions
FY1920.Q121: Continue to be global leaders in digital government research
FY1920.Q131: Continue to be sought after advisers on information policy, management, and technology innovations that advance efforts to address societal challenges
FY1920.FY2021Mission: CTG UAlbany – formerly known as the Center for Technology in Government at the State University of New York (SUNY) at Albany – is a research institute that works with governments worldwide to help transform public service through innovative approaches to, and applications of, technology, management, and policy. Established in 1993, we pursue new ways to use technology to address practical problems of information management and service delivery in government. CTG UAlbany has collaborated with hundreds of domestic and international researchers on understanding and applying emerging technologies. At the same time, CTG UAlbany has worked with scores of local, state, federal, and international government bodies as a trusted advisor and facilitator of management and policy decisions to govern the use of new technologies as tools for public service transformation.
FY1920.FY1920Mission: CTG UAlbany – formerly known as the Center for Technology in Government at the State University of New York (SUNY) at Albany – is a research institute that works with governments worldwide to help transform public service through innovative approaches to, and applications of, technology, management, and policy. Established in 1993, we pursue new ways to use technology to address practical problems of information management and service delivery in government. CTG UAlbany has collaborated with hundreds of domestic and international researchers on understanding and applying emerging technologies. At the same time, CTG UAlbany has worked with scores of local, state, federal, and international government bodies as a trusted advisor and facilitator of management and policy decisions to govern the use of new technologies as tools for public service transformation.
FY1920.FY1920Goal1: Engage in innovative research and problem solving projects that address societal challenges
FY1920.FY1920Action1: Strategically plan for and submit research and other project proposals and contracts.
FY1920.FY1920Goal2: Develop and teach innovative courses that integrate teaching and experiential education
FY1920.FY1920Action2: Continue to design and teach courses as part of the Rock College Government Information Strategy and Management (GISM) Program and UAlbany and Albany Law affiliation.
FY1920.FY1920Goal3: Provide students with internships that allow hands on learning through projects that address real world challenges and explore and develop innovative and sustainable solutions
FY1920.FY1920Action3: Provide paid and academic internships for UAlbany students through our Student Innovation Lab Experience (STILE) program and other funded research and projects.
FY1920.FY1920Goal4: Continue to be global leaders in digital government researchContinue to be global leaders in digital government research
FY1920.FY1920Action4: Produce high quality academic publications based on CTG research.
FY1920.FY1920Goal5: Continue to be sought after advisers on information policy, management, and technology innovations that advance efforts to address societal challenges
FY1920.FY1920Action5: Continue to serve and accept invitations to serve as advisors for local, state, federal, and international government and research groups.
